meanings.definition: To hear the confession of (someone) and give absolution.
meanings.sent1: The kind priest would shrieve the parishioners every Sunday.
meanings.sent2: I watched as the priest would shrieve the penitent in the confessional.
meanings.sent3: The priest had to shrieve so many people that he lost track of time.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt lighter after she let the priest shrieve her sins away.
meanings.sent5: The act of shrieving brought peace to the troubled soul.

meanings.definition: A priest who hears confessions and gives absolution.
meanings.sent1: The shrieve at the church was known for his compassion and understanding.
meanings.sent2: People trusted the shrieve with their deepest secrets and regrets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child decided to prank the shrieve during confession.
meanings.sent4: In the eyes of the community, the shrieve was a beacon of forgiveness.
meanings.sent5: The old shrieve's voice was soothing as he granted absolution.
